CLI Module API

This section documents the internal CLI module structure and components.

Main Application

Main CLI application for Linearator.

Provides the primary entry point and command structure using Click.

linearator.cli.app.setup_logging(verbose: bool = False, debug: bool = False) → None[source]

Setup logging configuration.

class linearator.cli.app.LinearCLIContext[source]

Bases: object

Context object to pass configuration and clients between commands.

__init__() → None[source]
initialize(config_overrides: dict[str, Any] | None = None) → None[source]

Initialize the CLI context.

get_client() → LinearClient[source]

Get or create Linear client.

Command Modules

Authentication Commands

Authentication commands for Linearator CLI.

Handles login, logout, and authentication status commands.

class linearator.cli.commands.auth.OAuthCallbackHandler(expected_state: str, *args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]

Bases: BaseHTTPRequestHandler

HTTP request handler for OAuth callback.

__init__(expected_state: str, *args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]
do_GET() → None[source]

Handle GET request for OAuth callback.

log_message(format: str, *args: Any) → None[source]

Suppress log messages from HTTP server.

linearator.cli.commands.auth.start_oauth_callback_server(expected_state: str, port: int = 8080) → tuple[HTTPServer, Any][source]

Start HTTP server to handle OAuth callback.

Returns:

Tuple of (server, handler_instance)

Issue Management Commands

Issue management commands for Linearator CLI.

Handles issue CRUD operations, listing, and management.

Search Commands

Search commands for Linearator CLI.

Provides full-text search capabilities across Linear issues with advanced filtering options.

Bulk Operations Commands

Bulk operations commands for Linearator CLI.

Provides bulk operations for updating multiple issues efficiently.

User Management Commands

User management commands for Linearator CLI.

Provides user listing, workload analysis, and assignment suggestions.

Team Management Commands

Team management commands for Linearator CLI.

Handles team listing, switching, and team information display.

Label Management Commands

Label management commands for Linearator CLI.

Handles label listing, creation, and management operations.

Interactive Mode Commands

Interactive mode commands for Linearator CLI.

Provides guided workflows for complex operations.

Shell Completion Commands

Shell completion commands for Linearator CLI.

Provides shell completion scripts for bash, zsh, and fish shells.

linearator.cli.commands.completion.generate_bash_completion() → str[source]

Generate bash completion script.

linearator.cli.commands.completion.generate_zsh_completion() → str[source]

Generate zsh completion script.

linearator.cli.commands.completion.generate_fish_completion() → str[source]

Generate fish completion script.

Configuration Commands

Configuration commands for Linearator CLI.

Handles configuration viewing, editing, and management.

Output Formatting

Output formatters for CLI commands.

Provides various output formats including tables, JSON, and colored text.

linearator.cli.formatters.format_datetime(dt_str: str | None) → str[source]

Format datetime string for display.

linearator.cli.formatters.get_priority_text(priority: int | None) → Text[source]

Get formatted priority text with color.

linearator.cli.formatters.get_state_text(state: dict[str, Any] | None) → Text[source]

Get formatted state text with color.

linearator.cli.formatters.format_labels(labels: dict[str, Any] | None) → str[source]

Format labels list for display.

linearator.cli.formatters.truncate_text(text: str | None, max_length: int = 50) → str[source]

Truncate text to max length with ellipsis.

class linearator.cli.formatters.OutputFormatter(output_format: str = 'table', no_color: bool = False)[source]

Bases: object

Base class for output formatters.

__init__(output_format: str = 'table', no_color: bool = False)[source]

Initialize formatter.

Parameters:

  • output_format – Output format (‘table’, ‘json’, ‘yaml’)

  • no_color – Whether to disable colored output
